messages.message:
few potential questions i can see from CapOne after thinking more about this:
1. is this available on every IB version or will they need to upgrade / make sure they’re on a version?
2. given files are saved in memory in “fast mode” are there resource concerns we need to be aware of?

3. how do they setup a “fast mode” flow, is it some sort of hidden variable or a header in a call?
4. do we have any other customers running this?
5. is there a data retention danger if we’re not writing files to disk? (not sure this applies to their use-case but more generally curious)
pinging the questions above! (call is in about an hour) @Kerry @Mohit

hey sorry that i missed this
1. this is available on any IB version _this year_ , i think 
2. there is, although we need to do more tests to let you know what the resource limit is. we currently use this fast mode for marketplace’s try-it feature, which limits the input file to be <5mb. 
3. you don’t need to “set up” fast mode, it’s an API call.  
4. it’s been used actively for marketplace’s try-it feature for a long time 
5. so the api returns with the extracted data. no files are written out - all the data are in cache.

do we have documentation on how to run in fast mode?  CapOne was asking about the API call and if it's a different endpoint or just a specific header.  I also couldn't find it in marketplace...maybe I'm just looking in the wrong place.
@Mohit ah is that what they should using?  I saw that doc but it didn’t call out anything about a fast mode or storing in memory or anythi g

Yes, we need to document this API better, its the same API @Kerryis talking about. Until now, only instabase marketplace was the user. Now that we have external users interested in the API, we will improve documentation.

There is no header needed for fast mode, this API endpoint itself is a faster version of our normal run flow api. Please note that this API is designed to be used for one input file at a time.
i see i see, thank you!
